sen.j: 箕作 省吾（みつくり しょうご、文政4年（1821年）- 弘化3年12月13日 (旧暦)（1847年1月29日））は、江戸時代後期の日本の地理学者。
sen.e: Shogo MITSUKURI (date of birth unknown, 1821 - January 29, 1847) was a Japanese geographer in the late Edo period.
Shogo MITSUKURI (date of birth unknown, 1821 - January 29, 1847) was a Japanese geographer in the late Edo period.
Shogo MITSUKURI (date of birth unknown, 1821 - January 29, 1847) was a Japanese geographer in the late Edo period.
His myo (another name) was Kan and aza (nom de plume) was Gyokukai.
His another name was Kan, and azana (Chinese courtesy name used in place of given name in formal situations; Japanese scholars and literati adopted this custom) was Gyokukai.
sen.cmt: 「名」→名前には諱（本名）や通称などがありましたが、「みょう」という呼び方があったわけではないので、ここでは別名という意味だと思います。「字」→"nom de plume"だとペンネーム、「号」のように思われます。訳が難しいです。
sen.e: His another name was Kan, and azana (Chinese courtesy name used in place of given name in formal situations; Japanese scholars and literati adopted this custom) was Gyokukai.

sen.j: 陸奥国（後の陸中国）水沢藩士佐々木秀規の次男として生まれた。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Hidenori SASAKI, feudal retainer of Mizusawa Domain in Mutsu Province (later Rikuchu no kuni Province).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Hidenori SASAKI, feudal retainer of the Mizusawa clan in Mutsu Province (later Rikuchu Province).
sen.cmt: 「水沢藩」を修正しました。（用語統一リスト）"Rikuchu no kuni Province"→"no kuni"は"province"と重複し、不要なので削除しました。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Hidenori SASAKI, feudal retainer of the Mizusawa clan in Mutsu Province (later Rikuchu Province).

sen.j: はじめ水沢市の蘭医で高野長英の師であった坂野長安に蘭学・漢学を学んだ。
sen.e: He first did Western studies and Sinology with Choei BANNO who taught Choei TAKANO who became a Western physician in Mizusawa City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He first did Western studies and Sinology with Choan BANNO (坂野長安), who was a physician of Western medicine in Mizusawa City and teacher of Choei TAKANO.
sen.cmt: 「水沢市の蘭医」は高野長英ではなく坂野長安を修飾する句だと思います。「坂野長安」→読み方不明です。元の訳のまま「ばんの」としていますが、「さかの」と読む可能性もあると思います。用語統一リストに従って、（）で漢字を挿入しました。
sen.e: He first did Western studies and Sinology with Choan BANNO (坂野長安), who was a physician of Western medicine in Mizusawa City and teacher of Choei TAKANO.

sen.j: その後江戸・京都に出て蘭学を修めた。
sen.e: He then went to Edo and Kyoto to complete his Western studies.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He then went to Edo and Kyoto to complete his Western studies.
He then went to Edo and Kyoto to complete his Western studies.

sen.j: 関西各地の景勝の地を訪ねて、各地の地勢・通路・産業や風俗などを調べた。
sen.e: He visited scenic spots in Kansai region to explore its topographies, routes, industries and life styles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He visited scenic spots in Kansai region to explore its topographies, routes, industries and life styles.
He visited scenic spots in Kansai region to explore its topographies, routes, industries and life styles.

sen.j: 省吾が地理学を専門とする契機であった。
sen.e: This led him to specialize in geography.
This led him to specialize in geography.
This led him to specialize in geography.

sen.j: いったん水沢に戻り引き続き坂野長安に学んだ。
sen.e: He however returned to Mizusawa to study with Choan BANNO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He then returned to Mizusawa to continue studying with Choan BANNO.
sen.cmt: 原文に忠実に、"however"より"then"が良いと思います。「引き続き」とあるので"continue"を挿入しました。「坂野長安」→読み方不明です。元の訳のまま「ばんの」としていますが「さかの」と読む可能性もあると思います。
sen.e: He then returned to Mizusawa to continue studying with Choan BANNO.

sen.j: 長安の講義の中で箕作阮甫の偉大さに触れ、再び江戸に出て阮甫の弟子となった。
sen.e: He came to know about great Genpo MITSUKURI during Choan's lecture and went to Edo once again to become Genpo's disciple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He came to know about great Genpo MITSUKURI during Choan's lecture and went to Edo once again to become Genpo's disciple.
He came to know about great Genpo MITSUKURI during Choan's lecture and went to Edo once again to become Genpo's disciple.

sen.j: 省吾は阮甫に才能を認められて阮甫の四女・しん（ちま）と結婚し、箕作家の婿養子となった。
sen.e: Recognizing Shogo's talents, Genpo adopted him as his son-in-law by marrying him with Shin (Chima), his fourth daughter.
Recognizing Shogo's talents, Genpo adopted him as his son-in-law by marrying him with Shin (Chima), his fourth daughter.
Recognizing Shogo's talents, Genpo adopted him as his son-in-law by marrying him with Shin (Chima), his fourth daughter.

sen.j: 弘化2年（1845年）省吾は日本初の世界地図である『新製輿地全図』（しんせいよちぜんず）と、その解説書で西洋地理書の『坤輿図識』（こんよずしき）を著した。
sen.e: In 1845 Shogo published Japan's first map of the world "Shinsei yochi zenzu" (A New Complete Map of the World) and "Konyo zushiki" (An Overview of the Geography of the Word) that describes the former as well as Western geography.

In 1845 Shogo published Japan's first map of the world "Shinsei yochi zenzu" (A New Complete Map of the World) and "Konyo zushiki" (An Overview of the Geography of the World) that explains the former as well as Western geography.
sen.cmt: 「解説書」なので、"describe"より"explain"の方が良いと思います。『坤輿図識』→（）内、"world"スペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: In 1845 Shogo published Japan's first map of the world "Shinsei yochi zenzu" (A New Complete Map of the World) and "Konyo zushiki" (An Overview of the Geography of the World) that explains the former as well as Western geography.

sen.j: そのため世界地図を日本で最初に紹介した人物として省吾は日本の地理学の歴史に名前を残すことになった。
sen.e: This is why his name is imprinted on the geographical history of Japan as the one who introduced a world map to the country for the first time.
This is why his name is imprinted on the history of Japanese geography as the one who introduced a world map to the country for the first time.
sen.cmt: 「地理学の歴史」→"geographical history of Japan"は「地理学的な日本史」で違和感があります。
sen.e: This is why his name is imprinted on the history of Japanese geography as the one who introduced a world map to the country for the first time.

sen.j: しかし、世界の地理学の学術書の訳述に全知全能を傾けたため心労のあまり結核に侵された。
sen.e: Single-mindedly devoted to the translation of foreign geographical texts, he was so mentally exhausted as to contract tuberculosis.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Single-mindedly devoted to the translation of foreign geographical texts, he was so mentally exhausted as to contract tuberculosis.

sen.j: 一粒種の貞一郎（のちの箕作麟祥）を遺して26歳の若さで永眠した。
sen.e: He died young at the age of 26, leaving his only son, Teiichiro (later Rinsho Mitsukuri), fatherless.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He died young at the age of 26, leaving his only son, Teiichiro (later Rinsho MITSUKURI), fatherless.
sen.cmt: 「箕作麟祥」の姓を大文字表記に修正しました。
sen.e: He died young at the age of 26, leaving his only son, Teiichiro (later Rinsho MITSUKURI), fatherless.

sen.j: しん未亡人は姉つね（阮甫の三女で阮甫の婿養子・秋坪の妻）の死後箕作秋坪の後妻となった。
sen.e: His widow, Shin, was remarried to Shusaku MITSUKURI after the death of her elder sister Tsune (who was the third daughter of Genpo and wife of Shusaku, Genpo's adopted son-in-law).
